meanings.definition: Give (someone) the authority or power to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher impowers the students to lead the class discussion.
meanings.sent2: The manager impowers her team to make decisions independently.
meanings.sent3: The superhero impowered the citizens with the ability to stand up against injustice.
meanings.sent4: The magic wand impowers the wizard to cast powerful spells.
meanings.sent5: The crown impowers the king to rule the kingdom with wisdom.

meanings.definition: Make (someone) stronger and more confident, especially in controlling their life and claiming their rights.
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise impowers individuals to take on physical challenges.
meanings.sent2: Supportive friends impower you to believe in yourself.
meanings.sent3: The motivational speaker impowered the audience to chase their dreams.
meanings.sent4: The success story impowers others to strive for their goals.
meanings.sent5: The inspiring book impowers readers to overcome obstacles with determination.
